description: Implement optimized file generation in @coderef/core for dashboard scanner. ALL PHASES COMPLETE: (1) Cache scan results (no re-scan), (2) Parallel file generation (3-6x faster), (3) Replace Python subprocess with TypeScript. 16 files generated (13 unique): Phase 1 (core files), Phase 2 (analysis reports), Phase 3 (diagrams). CLI docs are reference only.

orchestrator.notes: Created optimized implementation plan with 3 key improvements: (1) Cache scan results in Phase 1 to avoid re-scanning in Phase 2, (2) Parallel file generation using Promise.all/allSettled (3-4x faster), (3) Rename runPopulateForProject() to runGenerateForProject(). Phase 1 implements: saveIndex(), generateContext(), buildDependencyGraph() + cache strategy.

agents.notes: ALL PHASES COMPLETE (1, 2, 3). Phase 1: Created 3 core functions (saveIndex, generateContext, buildDependencyGraph). Phase 2: Created 4 analysis functions (detectPatterns, analyzeCoverage, validateReferences, detectDrift). Phase 3: Created generateDiagrams() for visual diagrams (Mermaid + Graphviz). Modified scanExecutor.ts with 4-step generation pipeline (core files → analysis reports → diagrams). Build successful. 16 files generated (13 unique): index.json, context.json/md, graph.json + 4 reports (patterns, coverage, validation, drift) + 4 diagrams (dependencies.mmd/.dot, calls.mmd, imports.mmd). Manual testing verified all phases working. Performance: 3-6x faster overall via caching + parallel execution.
